nodes.description: 2016年3月27日，巴基斯坦拉合尔Gulshan-e-Iqbal公园发生自杀式爆炸袭击，造成至少70人死亡，包括29名儿童
nodes.support_text: More than 70 have been reported killed in Lahore in a suicide bombing. More than 70 have been reported killed in Lahore, Pakistan, after an alleged suicide-bomb attack.

nodes.description: 3月28日巴基斯坦启动三天哀悼期，拉合尔关闭学校与市场，官方确认死亡人数达70人
nodes.support_text: the country started a three-day mourning period. schools and markets closed and little traffic.

nodes.description: 军方在旁遮普省展开五次突袭，逮捕恐怖分子及关联人员，缴获大批武器弹药
nodes.support_text: Security forces arrested a 'number of terrorist suspects and facilitators' in at least five separate raids... a huge cache of arms and ammunition was recovered.

nodes.description: 警方调查发现爆炸装置由自杀式背心实施，怀疑存在同伙，确认14名基督徒和44名穆斯林死亡
nodes.support_text: Police in Lahore said Monday that they were investigating whether the suicide bomber... 14 were Christian, 44 were Muslim.

nodes.description: 梵蒂冈谴责袭击为‘可憎暴行’，呼吁保护少数族裔
nodes.support_text: Pope Francis on Monday decried the Easter bombing as 'vile and abominable' and called for Pakistan's religious minorities to be protected.

nodes.description: 总理纳瓦兹·谢里夫取消华盛顿核峰会行程，前往拉合尔医院慰问伤者
nodes.support_text: Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif arrived in Lahore... canceling a trip to Washington.

nodes.description: ‘伊斯兰促进会’宣称对袭击负责，称目标为庆祝复活节的基督徒
nodes.support_text: Jamaat ul-Ahrar claimed responsibility for the attack... saying 'It was our people who attacked the Christians in Lahore, celebrating Easter.'

nodes.description: 受害者家属在爆炸现场发现残骸，包括儿童鞋履和珠宝，部分遇难者身份未明
nodes.support_text: Objects were left like small grace notes — a jeweled sandal, mangled reading glasses, a child's shoe. Some were clearly still in shock.

nodes.description: 伊斯兰教徒在伊斯兰堡抗议处决刺客，军队介入维持秩序
nodes.support_text: Thousands of Muslim demonstrators protesting the execution of Islamist assassin Mumtaz Qadri... army was deployed to protect government buildings.

nodes.description: 袭击引发对巴基斯坦政府反恐不力的质疑，终结2015年相对平静的反恐局面
nodes.support_text: horror. That calm period now seems to be over. horrified Pakistanis are again asking what their government can do to protect them from extremist violence.
